answers.answer: My sister had the same thing and actually delivered by c-section at 30+1. The best thing (although I know very difficult) is to calm down and not stress, that will make your blood pressure go up even higher. If they can keep your blood pressure down it's more likely you won't have to deliver so early.
Also I wish you the best of luck, everything will be okay momma!
@ShellyLette , I'm trying to stay calm but being 18 and a single parent and having to deal with this alone drives me crazy, just tryna be strong for my little one!

Yeah my sister couldn't either, and she's not a single parent.. It's a very scary thing to go through :( I would be freaking out too. I'm sorry you have to go through this. I wish there was more I could do than say not to stress, but there's really nothing that can be done. I'm sure the DR have told you there's no cure for pre-eclampsia except to deliver the baby. Have they given you steriod shots for the lungs or anything?

Yeah they already have gave me the steroid shots about a 2 weeks ago when i was here. right now they have me on some medicine to elevate my blood pressure until they decide to deliver. I'm not sure how long they will wait to deliver me though.

Do you know what gender you're having? What was the weight on your last u/s? My sisters u/s said 1lb the day she delivered but baby girl ended up being 2lb 5oz breathing perfectly on her own and she only got the shots the day before. I'm telling you this trying to give you a peace of mind..
I'm having a boy, and on my last u/s was when i was 28 weeks and 4 days and he was 2 pounds and 5.5 oz. it's just scary the thought of him being delievered early.

question: I'm 30 weeks and two days, and went to my ob-Gyn Thursday for a regular check up and my blood pressure was very high they sent me straight to the hospital. Now they want to keep me here for several weeks to monitor me and the baby before they induce me. They say i have mild case of preeclampsia. This is stressing me out!!
title: Preeclampsia!? Anybody
